ygData.messageBody:
The only task I could get was the dreadlands as well. It sent me to scout
out a lava flow in skyfire. To get the ok message I had to get in the lava
and aggroed several mobs. Thank goodness for sow, I out ran them then
ported out. The next task was to explore the first bridge in Veeshan's
peak. It is locked and requires a key that is no small quest. This is not
soloable. Oh well, back to grinding. This is typical, SOE's idea of solo
only requires a group of 5 or 6.
----- Original Message -----
From: "Chris Talbot" <chris@...>
To: <EverQuest@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Thursday, September 23, 2004 5:27 AM
Subject: RE: [EverQuest] Task system


> I've now got a couple of my characters working on tasks. My 49 ranger was
> advised by the task masters to go to Rathe Mountains for a task. I did,
> and
> everything was pointing me to Lower Guk. I've never really been through
> Upper and Lower Guk, and going that far underground with a ranger just
> makes
> me concerned.
>
> I abandoned the task. The next thing I tried was getting a task from a
> task
> master in Overthere. It sent me into Burning Woods, where one of the
> things
> I had to do was enter the giant fort and scout it out. To accomplish that,
> I
> discovered I had to run into the middle of the fort. I was invisible, but
> as
> soon as I got within agrro range, I started wailed on by a giant.
> Thankfully, a group was pulling giants from the fort, so it was somewhat
> abandoned. I trained a giant or two out and ran for the zone line. The
> next
> step is to kill 10 skeletons (can't remember exactly what type, but I know
> they con dark blue -- not sure how well bow-kiting will work in such a
> busy
> zone).
>
> Frustrated with such difficult and dangerous tasks for my 49 ranger, I
> tried
> a task with 10 cleric. I was sent into Innothule Swamp from a PoK task
> master and told to kill 10 bull alligators (most con white, some a healthy
> dark blue). I had to run for my life and died about 10 feet from the PoK
> book. I didn't realize bull alligators helped each other out. I got
> trounced
> by two of them.
>
> I'm becoming increasingly convinced that tasks are not soloable. :(
>
> Chris
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Nick Thompson [mailto:poolsharkbc@...]
>
> The only place that would give me a task was in the
> Dreadlands, and it sent me ( a 52 Druid) into Chardok
> for a recon mission. Thought it couldn't be that bad,
> but I had never been to Chardok before. The mission
> was to enter the fort inside Chardok and explore the
> area around the first bridge. Went in and found the
> fort (was invised) opened the door, it squeaks and
> every mob in Chardok seems to have heard it, and what
> resulted can only be described as Woodelf paste.
